atHomeSwitch.title: At Home Switch
atHomeSwitch.description: Exposes a 'at home' switch to HomeKit to enable/disable at home for the interface settings within HomeKit.

active.title: Active
active.description: Activates MQTT Broker for MQTT-based automation. If not set, MQTT support is not started.

tls.title: MQTT TLS
tls.description: Use TLS to connect to the MQTT broker.

host.title: MQTT Server
host.description: Defines the hostname or IP of the MQTT broker to connect to for MQTT-based automation. If not set, MQTT support is not started.

port.title: MQTT Port
port.description: The port of the MQTT broker.

username.title: MQTT Username
username.description: The username used to connect to your MQTT broker. If not set, no authentication is used.

password.title: MQTT Password
password.description: The password used to connect to your MQTT broker. If not set, no authentication is used.

active.title: Active
active.description: Activates HTTP Server for HTTP-based automation. If not set, HTTP support is not started.

port.title: HTTP Port
port.description: The port to listen on for HTTP-based automation. If not set, HTTP support is not started.

localhttp.title: HTTP Localhost Only
localhttp.description: Only allow HTTP calls from localhost. Useful if using helper plugins that translate to HTTP.

active.title: Active
active.description: Activates STMP Server for Email-based automation. If not set, SMTP support is not started.

port.title: SMtP Port
port.description: The port to run the SMTP server on.

space_replace.title: Space replace
space_replace.description: The character to replace a space with in the camera name portion of the email address.

active.title: Active
active.description: Activates SSL (HTTPS) for the User Interface

videoProcessor.title: Video Processor
videoProcessor.description: Defines which video processor is used to decode and encode videos, must take the same parameters as FFmpeg. Common uses would be 'avconv' or the path to a custom-compiled version of FFmpeg. If not set, will use the included version of FFmpeg, or the version of FFmpeg installed on the system if no included version is available.

name.title: Name
name.description: Set the camera name for display in the Home app.

manufacturer.name: Manufacturer
manufacturer.description: Set the manufacturer name for display in the Home app.

model.name: Model
model.description: Set the model for display in the Home app.

serialNumber.name: Serial Number
serialNumber.description: Set the serial number for display in the Home app.

firmwareRevision.name: Firmware Revision
firmwareRevision.description: Set the firmware revision for display in the Home app.

excludeSwitch.title: Exclude Switch
excludeSwitch.description: Exposes a 'exclude' switch to HomeKit to exclude/include the camera from the interface settings within HomeKit.

motion.title: Enable Motion Sensor
motion.description: Exposes the motion sensor for this camera. This can be triggered with the dummy switches, MQTT messages, or via HTTP, depending on what features are enabled in the config.

doorbell.title: Enable Doorbell
doorbell.description: Exposes the doorbell device for this camera. This can be triggered with the dummy switches, MQTT messages, or via HTTP, depending on what features are enabled in the config.

switches.title: Enable Dummy Switches
switches.description: Enables dummy switches to trigger motion and/or doorbell, if either of those are enabled. When enabled there will be an additional switch that triggers the motion or doorbell event.

motionTimeout.title: Automatic Motion Reset (Seconds)
motionTimeout.description: The number of seconds after triggering to reset the motion sensor. Set to 0 to disable resetting of motion trigger for MQTT or HTTP. This will also affect the interface timeout.

motionDoorbell.title: Trigger Doorbell with Motion
motionDoorbell.description: Rings the doorbell when motion is activated. This allows for motion alerts to appear on Apple TVs.

unbridge.title: Unbridge Camera (Recommended)
unbridge.description: Bridged cameras can cause slowdowns of the entire Homebridge instance. If unbridged, the camera will need to be added to HomeKit manually.

hsv.title: HomeKit Secure Video (HSV)
hsv.description: Enables HSV for the camera. This setting also affects the recording settings in the user interface. HSV requires a home hub and iCloud plan with at least 200GB of storage.

source.title: Video Source
source.description: FFmpeg options on where to find and how to decode your camera's video stream. The most basic form is '-i' followed by your camera's URL.

stillImageSource.title: Still Image Source
stillImageSource.description: If your camera also provides a URL for a still image, that can be defined here with the same syntax as 'source'. If not set, the plugin will grab one frame from 'source'.

readRate.title: Read Rate
readRate.description: Read input at native frame rate (-re).

analyzeDuration.title: Analyze Duration
analyzeDuration.description: Specify how many microseconds are analyzed to probe the input. A higher value will enable detecting more accurate information, but will increase latency. It defaults to 5,000,000 microseconds = 5 seconds (-analyzeduration).

probeSize.title: Probe Size
probeSize.description: Set probing size in bytes, i.e. the size of the data to analyze to get stream information. A higher value will enable detecting more information in case it is dispersed into the stream, but will increase latency. Must be an integer not lesser than 32. It is 5000000 by default (-probesize).

reorderQueueSize.title: Reorder Queue Size (Jitter buffer size)
reorderQueueSize.description: Packets may be received out of order, so before they can be passed onwards, they need to be reordered. Default jitter buffer size is 500. This option allows you to specify it manually. Higher values will lead to greater latency. Only applicable for reception over UDP (-reorder_queue_size).

maxDelay.title: Max Delay
maxDelay.description: When receiving data over UDP, the demuxer tries to reorder received packets (since they may arrive out of order, or packets may get lost totally). This can be disabled by setting the maximum demuxing delay to zero (-max_delay).

returnAudioTarget.title: Two-way Audio Target (EXPERIMENTAL - WIP)
returnAudioTarget.description: The FFmpeg output command for directing audio back to a two-way capable camera. This feature is still in development and a configuration that works today may not work in the future.

maxStreams.title: Maximum Concurrent Streams
maxStreams.description: The maximum number of streams that will be allowed at once to this camera.

maxWidth.title: Maximum Width
maxWidth.description: The maximum width used for video stream. If set to 0, the resolution of the source is used. If not set, will use any size HomeKit requests (-s).

maxHeight.title: Maximum Height
maxHeight.description: The maximum height used for video stream. If set to 0, the resolution of the source is used. If not set, will use any size HomeKit requests (-s).

maxFPS.title: Maximum Framerate
maxFPS.description: The maximum frame rate used for video streamed to HomeKit. If set to 0, the framerate of the source is used. If not set, will use any framerate HomeKit requests (-r).

maxBitrate.title: Maximum Bitrate
maxBitrate.description: The maximum bitrate used for video stream, in kbit/s. If not set, will use any bitrate HomeKit requests (-b:v).

forceMax.title: Force Maximums
forceMax.description: If set, the settings requested by HomeKit will be overridden with any 'maximum' values defined in this config.

vcodec.title: Video Codec
vcodec.description: Set the codec used for encoding video sent to HomeKit, must be H.264-based. You can change to a hardware accelerated video codec with this option, if one is available (-vcodec).

packetSize.title: Packet Size
packetSize.description: If audio or video is choppy try a smaller value.

stimeout.title: Socket Timeout
stimeout.description: Socket TCP I/O timeout in seconds. If you have problems with hanging FFmpeg processes in the background, you can enter any value here to stop the process automatically after the entered time, if no response comes (-stimeout).

videoFilter.title: Additional Video Filters
videoFilter.description: Comma-delimited list of additional video filters for FFmpeg to run on the video. If 'none' is included, the default video filters are disabled (-filter:v).

encoderOptions.title: Encoder Options
encoderOptions.description: Options to be passed to the video encoder.

mapvideo.title: Video Stream
mapvideo.description: Selects the stream used for video (-map).

mapaudio.title: Audio Stream
mapaudio.description: Selects the stream used for audio (-map).

debug.title: FFmpeg Debug Logging
debug.description: Includes debugging output from the main FFmpeg process in the Homebridge log.

debugReturn.title: Two-way FFmpeg Debug Logging
debugReturn.description: Includes debugging output from the FFmpeg process used for two-way audio in the Homebridge log.

motionTopic.title: Motion Topic Prefix
motionTopic.description: The MQTT topic to watch for motion alerts. The topic (prefix/suffix) should be unique, it will be used to assign the motion detected message to the desired camera.

motionMessage.title: Motion Message
motionMessage.description: The message to watch for to trigger motion alerts.

motionResetTopic.title: Motion Reset Topic
motionResetTopic.description: The MQTT topic to watch for motion resets. The topic (prefix/suffix) should be unique, it will be used to assign the reset motion message to the desired camera.

motionResetMessage.title: Motion Reset Message
motionResetMessage.description: The message to watch for to trigger motion resets.

doorbellTopic.title: Doorbell Topic
doorbellTopic.description: The MQTT topic to watch for doorbell alerts. The topic (prefix/suffix) should be unique, it will be used to assign the doorbell message to the desired camera.

doorbellMessage.title: Doorbell Message
doorbellMessage.description: The message to watch for to trigger doorbell alerts. Will use the name of the camera if blank.
